title: REPLICATION_USAGE_HISTORY view | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs:
The REPLICATION_USAGE_HISTORY view in the ORGANIZATION_USAGE schema can
be used to query the replication history for databases in your organization
within a specified date range. The view includes
the database name, credits consumed, and bytes transferred for replication.

This view only displays replication usage for database replication.
To view usage for replication using replication and failover groups,
see the REPLICATION_GROUP_USAGE_HISTORY view.
Name of the organization where the usage took place.
Name of the account where the usage took place.
Name of the region where the account is located.
Date (in the UTC time zone) of this usage record.
Total number of credits used for database replication during the USAGE_DATE.
Number of bytes transferred for database replication during the USAGE_DATE.
Latency for the view may be up to 24 hours (1 day).
The data is retained for 365 days (1 year).
